definition: to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard

sentences.english: Underestimate Ren at your peril, Ren's competitors say.
sentences.chinese: 竞争对手们说，小看任正非就是在冒险。

sentences.english: Mam belittles himself and others will belittle him.
sentences.chinese: 一个人小看自己，别人也会小看他。

sentences.english: Mam belittles himself and others will belittle him.
sentences.chinese: 一个人小看自己，别人也会小看他。

sentences.english: He is young and inexperienced, but please do not count that against him (look down upon him).
sentences.chinese: 他年轻又无经验，但请不要因此而小看他。

sentences.english: You shouldn't belittle this tiny embroidered needle. It can play a big role sometime.
sentences.chinese: 小看这小小的绣花针，可以绣出大文章。

sentences.english: You can't look down upon these courtyards, it took more time than any buildings.
sentences.chinese: “别小看这些院落，建的时辰，可比盖楼费功夫”。

sentences.english: To neglect the little things, in whatever you are doing, can be disasterous .
sentences.chinese: 无论你在做什么，小事小看可能会带来不幸。

sentences.english: I used to drive ship in my hometown. Trust me!
sentences.chinese: 小意思，你别小看我，我在老家就常开船。

sentences.english: Do not belittle what he has achieved.
sentences.chinese: 不能小看他取得的成绩。

sentences.english: To make Wellington so great is to belittle England.
sentences.chinese: 把威灵顿捧得那样高便是小看了英格兰。

sentences.english: This is not to belittle the enormous progress in the development of refractories.
sentences.chinese: 这并非是小看耐火材料发展中的巨大进步。

sentences.english: Now, nobody should be misconstruing the Lakers' defense for that of the Warriors.
sentences.chinese: 现在，应该没有人会小看这帮家伙的防守了吧。

sentences.english: Don't despise our doctors, we earn our living by handling swords, too.
sentences.chinese: 不要小看我们大夫，我们也是拿刀混饭吃的。

sentences.english: She had underestimated us. We would not have dreamed of questioning her.
sentences.chinese: 她小看了我们，我们并不会企图质疑她。

definition: to belittle/to look down upon/to despise
treat sth lightly/to lower one's guard
to belittle/to scorn/to take sth lightly
to compare/to draw a parallel/to match/analogy/metaphor/comparison
to misinterpret what one sees or reads/to misjudge (sb)/to mistake (sb for sb else)/to misread (a document)
that's just the way it is/exactly!
to show respect for/to think highly of
